website_summaries.verdict: With a bargain-basement price, the HP OfficeJet 4215 is a multitalented, multifunction printer for the home or the office.
pros: Prints, copies, scans, and faxes well

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Pleased with the printer and service.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased! The printer was supposed to arrive by October 29. I received it on October 13. The thing that impressed me with this vendor is that he was kind enough to include new ink. He also included the printer cord, telephone/fax cord and USB cable. The printer was clean, like new just as promised and all components work (print, fax, copier and scanner. He even included an alignment page. I would definitely use and recommend this vendor. The printer runs quietly and smoothly. I had this exact printer but it stopped working. I think it is one of the best that HP made and I am thankful to have one again. Kudos to this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: annmarie

customer_reviews.title: Used--didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I bought this as a replacement to my old one. Didn't hold a candle to my original. Didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: aka

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact, and easy. Can be programmed to use only black ink cartridge. Owned one for 12 years before. Works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this before. Small, compact, and easy. Can be programmed to use only black ink cartridge. Owned one for 12 years and only bought 1 color cartridge. This printer is perfect for this age of paperless technology. Does not defect on "expired" ink. Have only ever used genuine hp ink. Printer cartridges are about 5 dollars with free shipping on competitor site.
customer_reviews.author: epictetus

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this item
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this item. I can't purchase the color cartridge for this All in One Printer. I did however purchase the black cartridge and cable to make it work. But is just wants to stay on Fax mode. I don't need or want a fax machine. I just wanted a printer that work. After spending the extra money for the cable and black cartridge it is still unuseable. Plus it is huge, takes up a lot of room for something that won't do what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Drema D.Pauley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer !
customer_reviews.text: GREATEST PRINTER EVER MADE !!!! Why HP discontinued it is a mystery to me...it does it all and is small, fast, reliable and compact !
customer_reviews.author: PattiB

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with my printer
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with my printer. I had one that lasted for many years. I am happy to have another one and I hope that it lasts just as long or even longer. I didn't have to change cartridges. I could use the same ones that I had been using.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Young

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for around 6 yrs and loved it because it was easy on ink and fit perfectly in a small area. When it would no longer copy I started looking for another one on-line but they were all too expensive and not in great shape. This one was advertised as 'like new' and is. It even came with the ink cartridges. I couldn't be happier with this product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I had one like this that was hit by lightning
customer_reviews.text: I had one like this that was hit by lightning. I purchased this one due to lots of ink cartridges I had in stock. Works aok...it is an used one.... but does the job fairly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Skraba

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!
customer_reviews.text: Printer has nice features but the paper feeder is TERRIBLE! This thing has never worked well since I purchased it several years ago. I have cleaned the feeder wheels several times and it helps for about 10 pages then farts out again. I often fantasize about throwing this printer off a very high building and watching it smash into a million pieces or running it over with my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Product was a refurbished, would never buy again as paper constantly jams, sorry I did not check it out before I could return.
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not getting this connected sooner, spent most of today trying to print, and copy. there are constant paper jams..I can not use, I would not buy a refurbished again.
customer_reviews.author: TC1

customer_reviews.title: The printer that was purchased
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item I was excited that it had both the back and colored ink cartridges full, plus an extra black cartridge along with it, that's where the excitement ended. Once the printer was plugged in and should have been functional there was an un-resolvable paper jam that is unable to be fixed. When I called HP for diagnostic help with this problem I was told that this particular product was unable to be warrantied and that they couldn't help with any problems that may be happening. I will have to return this product and go through the headache of getting a new printer that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: jeffery

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Only one word to describe this made in china is JUNK hasn't work since it was purchased and HP customer service won't help with out buying a contract and the ink is too expensive, sorry I gave away my lexmark that still worked
customer_reviews.author: sunny3818

customer_reviews.title: Easy - no cd
customer_reviews.text: It works well for being refurbished. Easy - no cd, it automatically downloads drivers.
customer_reviews.author: ss1987

customer_reviews.title: Printer for home
customer_reviews.text: printer did not work . Did not feed paper. Had to return it. I am old and wanted this particular printer as I already have one and am familiar with it. Guess I will have to go to Staples and buy some other brand but thanks for your help. C G KLEPPINGER
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Kleppinger

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet 4215 All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the fax, but after setting it up it worked so great that I made it my default printer would buy again. Good packing and quick shipping
customer_reviews.author: FGJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well but has interface problems with Mac OS 10.3
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but refuses to acknowledge acceptance of set-up instructions and irritatingly asks everytime a new user logs on. We use Mac OS 10.3.9. We found a fix for 10.4 on the HP Support page, but it was very complicated and didn't work for us. We'll check the HP site again in future in the hopes a diffferent fix will work for us. The printer itself was a breeze to set up, works fine, and delivers clean, sharp copies. The problem is with the software.
customer_reviews.author: Copacetic Co

customer_reviews.title: faulty
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not work the roll will not allow the paper to go through. it just makes a noise but does not work.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and in great condition. Has been working great since. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: bonnie hayman

customer_reviews.title: HP OFFICEJET 4215 ALL IN ONE
customer_reviews.text: VERY EFFICENT MULTIPURPOSE PRINTER, QUALITY OF THIS PRINTER IS VERY GOOD. THE SPEED IS ALSO GOOD. IT HAS BETTER INK CAPACITY THAN ITS NEWER MODEL THE HP 4315 WHICH TAKES LESSER CAPACITY INK. OVERALL ITS THE SAME PRINTER,BUT SINCE I USE MUCH MORE COLOR AND BLACK INK EVERYDAY I SAY BUY A REFURBED 4215.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chase

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 4215. The first was fried by a lightening strike through the telephone (fax) connection. I've always perferred HP printers and this one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: This all in one is built to much higher quality standards than my previous machine which was a Brother(piece of junk) This machine is very easy to use both as a Stand Alone or from my home PC The software is great and offers an auto update feature. Also it has a very small "footprint" so it fits well into small places.Buy It!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Palermo

customer_reviews.title: This printer when sent to me was not what was ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer when sent to me was not what was represented. It was filthy and the ink cartridges were not new. They were rolling around loose in the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mellisse Weldon Brydges

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST FOR LESS
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT SERVICE EXCELLENT PRICE EXCELLENT PRODUCT THIS HP 4215 ALL-IN-ONE WAS PACKAGED PERFECTLY ALL CORDS WERE NEW CONDITION THE CARTRIDGES ARE BOTH PERFECT WE WERE VERY IMPRESSED WITH THE WORKING CONDITION. THIS COMPANY AMAZING. I RECOMMEND THEM 10+
customer_reviews.author: steve*santa barbara

customer_reviews.title: hp 4215 printer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 4215 hp printer I received a 4315 printer. Ink was dried out and covered the printer front. After replacement of printer cartriges and lots of cleaning, printer looked new again. Printer does work.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: GoodBuy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good buy. It was delivered on time. The printer works very nicely. I will make all my future purpases from Amazon. It is safe, and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: smartc

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Came in excellent condition. Works beautifully. I was concerned about compatibility issues with my computer and Windows program which were later editions. No problem was experienced and I was able to install it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but...
customer_reviews.text: The all in one printer worked great at first, but then it started acting up more and more frequently. While the errors are fairly easy to take care of, it is still quite a bother.
customer_reviews.author: H. Chau

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box. Print quality has been good so far and came with print/ink already installed. Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L Cokain

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished HP 4215
customer_reviews.text: The printer works excellent! The machine is mostly used as a fax machine in my home. I like that it is small and conpact.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Zoeller

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works very good for my purpose and I a happy to be able to purchase the ink cartridges from the same site
customer_reviews.author: Bette Wager

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great, working clean and received as expected. Thank you, I rate it a 4 star!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BUTTERCUP

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase. Would like to send back my older 4215 printer to be repaired for the next purchaser.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Your product did not meet my expectations, it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Your product did not meet my expectations , it was defected . It was returned so I can be refunded .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one
customer_reviews.text: paper jams constantly.....basically have to feed a 1 month old printer 1 sheet at a time....unacceptable piece of junk....
customer_reviews.author: TexasJim

customer_reviews.title: No USB Cable?
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a good printer to me. That's why I bought it. But, I can't use it yet because it didn't come with a USB cable. It says this on the box, but I bought it via Amazon and didn't take the time to read the specs. Serves me right I guess. But, who sells a printer without the necessary cables? HP says the USB cable is optional...what a load of crap. Unless you have an HP USB cable already, add $20 to the purchase price. What a scam.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Good points: Very compact, great price, suprisingly good text quality, good fax interface, good-enough copying, good looks. Generous packaging: print cable (surprise!), phone cord, phone line splitter, etc. Bad points: Bad up-take from the paper tray, no direct-from-camera printing, unacceptable quality on scanned photos, can't effectively print envelopes or heavy paper, seems rather cheaply made -- I fear about its life expectancy. The Bad Points are serious considerations, but the 4215xi still a great buy for $80. So, it's good enough for me. I gave it three stars but I'm a tough grader, and there was no "half star" option.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: it served me for 6 years and still serving me flwlessly.
customer_reviews.text: i don't know why some people are discontent with this product and some people are happy and here i am extremely happy with this product because it served me for over 6 years flawlessly and never failed and still serves me without giving me any trouble. scanning printing and copying just perfect. inks last pretty long time too, i just forgot when was last time i replaced the inks. the only reason i am purchasing another HP B210, because of its compatibility with iPhone printing features. i will keep officejet 4210xi as an auxiliary printer.
customer_reviews.author: Lion King

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scanner (not printer) for academics who use GNU/Linux
customer_reviews.text: I've actually never used the printing function of this thing (gave the starter cartridge away). I only use the scanner to scan pages of research I write almost everyday. This puppy is AWESOME! HP made a mistake when they released an ADF scanner for just $100 (they could have easily charged a lot more). I scan pages to PGM format (with scanimage from xsane) and convert them to DJVU format (with c44), which saves a lot of space. I never have to worry about losing pages of work, and now they're a lot easier to find. Also, the two lids keep dust from accumulating inside, so my scanned pages still look clean after about 3 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Meph Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a couple of years, only because I couldn't afford to replace it. It worked great, for about 2 days. Then it developed a constant "remove and check right cartridge" message. I did everything possible to make this go away, but it never has. Nonetheless, it did print - most of the time. Quality is so-so. Scanning properties are terrible. And the fax is totally defunct now, for no reason I can detect. When I replace this awful piece of junk, I'm taking out in the garage & putting hammer to it! Will be a great release!
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Cline

customer_reviews.title: great all in one!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this all-in-one unit from BestBuy and must say it's the best budget printer I've purchased. It handles all my work-related and personal needs. My only complaint is that the unit needs a setting to auto-detect faxes. Right now, you can only set it to Tel, Answering Maching or Fax. If it's on Tel mode, faxes won't come through. If it's on Fax mode, callers immediately get the annoying fax tone. :( Overall though, reliability, print quality, and printer speed exceeds my expectaion for a $90 printer. I haven't really used the scanning feature much since I have a stand-alone flatbed scanner.
customer_reviews.author: jcam

customer_reviews.title: A perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned over a dozen printers and for a non-laser printer this is the best I've ever had. I've always been skeptical of the whole 'all in one' approach, but this printer genuinely prints, scans, faxes and copies perfectly. Easy to install, seamless to use and the ink cartridges seem to go on forever. I'd highly recommend this to anyone who needs an inkjet. By the way, the photo printing onto Kodak 4x6s is astonishing.
customer_reviews.author: James Beswick

customer_reviews.title: Ready to toss it out
customer_reviews.text: THis machine has made my life miserable. In the last 6 months, I don't think it has printed more than 3 faxes without jamming. TO make matters worse, the output tray is shared by the paper input tray. It just pulled in 6 pages of completed received faxes to use to print more faxes. I often find 2-sided faxes. This thing is way too tempermental and I'm tired of babysitting it. Not up to HP standards
customer_reviews.author: NYer family

customer_reviews.title: Great for home offfice
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my hp officejet 4215. I work outside of the home most of the time, however, at home for a couple of hours a day. I use all the functions on this machine and they all work great for the applications that I need them for. Although the printer is pretty slow for any kind of lengthy printing job, for the infrequent printing it works just fine. Good color copies too! I would recommend this product for any light printing home office.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Office Printer!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer a week ago and I love it. I paid 99.00 for mine at Office Depot but they gave a 15.00 gift card, so that made buying this printer a great buy. I haven't used the fax feature because I really don't have a need for it but I've scanned pictures already. The quality wasn't great but using the right software, you can enhance any photograph. By the way, I researched this printer to death and all the research paid off.
customer_reviews.author: IBperky

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet 4215
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't give 5 stars, but this thing is excellent. easy installation easy and nice printing, scanning, faxing, and copying quality. easy to replace the ink + the price for the ink is not bad. easy to maintaine easy to left and move if you need too.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, with reservations
customer_reviews.text: Good price & features, very good performance (trying printing something in FastDraft mode - simply amazing speed with VG quality). Will not co-exist with a NetGear usb print server, as its predecessor, an OfficeJet 300, was happy to do. If networked printing is a concern, consider other options.
customer_reviews.author: Qpgmr

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used it that much.
customer_reviews.text: This review may not be that informative because I've only printed a few pages. It was easy to set up and works fine. One thing, if you want to use the fax it needs a seperate phone line. I tried to use one line for both, but if I get a phone call it won't stop beeping at us when we're trying to talk.
customer_reviews.author: Edward H. Goodan

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: I've owned mine for years. Love it. Takes a beating and keeps on scanning/printing/faxing. Doesn't run out of ink as fast as the newer models and, the ink refills are priced reasonably, too.
customer_reviews.author: G Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Good All-In-One!
customer_reviews.text: The HP 4215 has been a good reliable printer/fax/copier for my home office. Software was easy to install and very user friendly. My only complaints are that it does not print well with UPS software/labels. Shipping info is often cut off and printed beyond the label borders. The ink cartridges are very small. Plan on replacing or refilling the black ink once a month with moderate printing/faxing/copying. Overall I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe

customer_reviews.title: Bad for the office.
customer_reviews.text: Prints regular paper fine, but try envelopes, or heaven forbid business card paper, and you're in for a world of frustration. It jams frequently with envelopes, and has tremendous trouble feeding business card paper properly. And it's a problem that can't really be helped. We bought it because it was cheap, we needed a new printer. If we knew about these problems beforehand (none of the reviews I read mentioned this, of course)we would have looked elsewhere. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy this Machine
customer_reviews.text: Had this 4215 All-in-one Printer for about two months. The paper feed for faxing has to be feed one by one or it will grab two pages at once. Also needs to be pushed to start as it dosent grab the pages without help. The paper tray holds about 125 sheets but HP Tech told me not to use more then 25 sheets otherwise printer grabs more then one sheet of paper. What good is an all-in-one that can only work with 25 Sheets of paper? Also uses alot of ink. Save your money and buy something else! I thought HP was better then this.
customer_reviews.author: H. Laufer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, broke after a couple of months!
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these printers. Usually, I love HP printers, but this particular model is a waste of money! I have one that has frequent paper jams and spits the pages out onto the floor and the other one began having carriage jams after only a couple of uses. Now, it won't work at all. Save your money and try a different model - wish I had.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie P

customer_reviews.title: Fast draft-mode printer but it copies only sheets
customer_reviews.text: We print mostly text and the fast draft mode looks fine and is very fast, a page in about five seconds. This is very nice. We have another HP All-in-One printer with a flat-bed scanner. I now realize how handy it is to have a sheet of glass to put things on to scan or copy. You can easily copy photos or do things like copy your passport or all the cards in your wallet. This printer only scans/copies sheets that will feed throught the sheet feeder. This is a big restriction. I would not get this it it will be your only scanner/copier.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer for exactly 1 year
customer_reviews.text: The print cartridge carriage jammed both times when I replaced print cartridges. I worked with an online tech and the end result is that it needs to be replaced. It's sad because it worked great for exactly one year. Here's what I liked about it: met my needs for sporadic faxing of 1-2 pages, good for scanning text, printed well even though it was a bit noisy, and copy quality was fine. It was easy to set up and easy to use. Also doesn't take up much space. It's a great value for the money. I may end up buying the exact same machine a second time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: but it still does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: My HP 4215 is now 12 YEARS OLD! Yes it creaks, squeaks, moans, and clunks, but it still does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: glen

customer_reviews.title: HP 4215  Multifunction ($143)
customer_reviews.text: A knockout price...now an HP owner for 30 days so far...I always owned Epsons but this machine is well worth the $$$...setup easy...have used all functions but scan (wife copies for her small SpecEd class and I fax/print for bass clubs' business, etc.)and the USB cable was no big deal...software works well...I have a G4 Mac..OS 10.3.5...not Windoze so maybe that could be a diff, maybe not...so far, I would suggest all those with low/small multi needs look closer at this unit...possible college dorm room dream machine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Schexnayder

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I needed a good cheap printer to print and maybe fax occasionally. It prints slow 17ppm? maybe 3-5 if your lucky. Paper jams unreal- w/only two peices of paper in the tray it will start jamming for NO reason, and you clear it and it jams itself all over again. WILL NOT BUY THIS AGAIN. You get what you pay for. For Faxing? it does a good job as long as you dont fax more than 5pages at a time other wise will grab 3-4 pages at one time so you have to refax whole reports over again. s
customer_reviews.author: Sherri A. Leduc

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet 4215 All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: For a small and compact all in one multi-functional printer, this one pulls quite a punch. It has good quality and speed and can be used with little interface. This is a home/office unit and shouldn't be considered for heavy business application. It works well for the student and everyday user. The software took longer than expected to load completely; dependent upon pc speed. The manual explains the functions and operations clearly. Overall, it's an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Tingle

customer_reviews.title: 100 Bucks?  You Have to be Kidding Me!
customer_reviews.text: What a bargain! Buy this product if you need a fax/printer/copier/scanner for your home office. You can't go wrong. Inexpensive, small (compact) and does everything it is supposed to do, as advertised. If you need these things, and have $100, don't even hesitate, click on "Add to Shopping Cart," you won't be disappointed. Concerned about the cost of ink? Well, good luck with ANY printer, that's where they make their money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gill

customer_reviews.title: Totally disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, the software didnt work so faxing and copying from the PC to the printer was unsuccessful. Then after just a couple months with hardly any use, my new printer failed to start. Emails to HP has not yet resolved this issue and it has been over 8 months since my first email to them. I was extremely disappointed with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rehana Ali

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing so much that I was moved to write a review...and that never happens. It worked ok for the first few months, but now I can't get it to print even one page now without some kind of an error or a paper jam. The copy/scanner part works fairly well but the scan quality isn't really very good. Hey, but the fax part is bullet proof.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garnett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Never gave me problems, easy to use, and great product. That's all their is too it. that's how simple it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: fast printing but
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fast and has good image quality but when changing cartridges it has to be rebooted and requires alignment several times. Obviously they didnt do quality checks on this one
customer_reviews.author: D. Becker

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet 4215 All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: I love the limited amount of space this printer takes up. I have used it to send faxes as well as make copies. My only complaint is that it is rather noisy - it always sounds like you are having a paper jam - and I have yet to fiqure out how not to print everything in color off of my computer. I would just as soon print everything in grayscale with color cartridges being as expensive as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: and what a deal... 99.99 ( plus the USB cord) Im very happy with my printer!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie R.

customer_reviews.title: OFFICE JET 4215
customer_reviews.text: NICE ALL IN ONE -- DELIVERED WAY BEFORE PROMISED DATE! VERY EASY TO SET UP. FAXES, COPIES, SCANS, PRINTS ~~ GREAT PRICE! NO PROBLEMS! IT'S A BIT NOISY, BUT NOTHING I CAN'T LIVE WITH!
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: HP OfficeJet 4215 All-in-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great printer for the $$$ and value of what you get. Pretty easy to use as well. Am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic all in one
customer_reviews.text: This unit has worked well for all modes (printer, scanner, fax and copier). The print quality is excellent which is why we picked the HP. It prints relatively slow but this is an excellent machine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Strayer

customer_reviews.title: It's Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: I found this product to be more wonderful than I expected. It's great, easy to set up easy to program, and easy to use. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a multi-function printer.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Champiney

customer_reviews.title: Great and Simple all in one
customer_reviews.text: I found this product to be all that I needed in one machine. It was very easy to install and does everything it says it will do. It has exceptional print quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: K. Fulton

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for my needs and I love all the features it has. I have a Bed & Breakfast & I use faxes and printers constantly.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Pantone

customer_reviews.title: BAD SOFTWARE AND PAPER HANDLING PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: The Officejet 4215 is a terrible printer with even worse software. After a month the HP would not load paper without loading 4-5 sheets at a time to print. Before you buy this product ask others who have owned it for more than three months.
customer_reviews.author: T. Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Expediency
customer_reviews.text: The fast service with Amazon and Bidabit was outstanding. The product seems to be working well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Fred E. Huffmaster

customer_reviews.title: not even a rating of a star its 0
customer_reviews.text: The mentioned hp officejet 4215 all-in-one never left your situs because I received a notice from amazon.com and was advised that someone dropped the officejet copier and it was damaged and was not shipped. So I rate this a 0, in the mean time I ordered another copier and to this date still have not received it. So right now I am not a satisfied customer. Diana
customer_reviews.author: Diana Stevenson-monmaney

product_meta.title: HP OfficeJet 4215 All-in-One Printer
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product Description The 4215 from HP helps you to save on valuable space by combining faxing, scanning, printing, and copying functions into one convenient unit. This full color multifunction is designed for home and small office use and features an inkjet printer with up to 1,200 x 1,200 dpi resolution (up to 4,800 x 1,200 dpi optimized color) and print speeds of up to 17 ppm for black and up to 12 ppm for color (at lower resolutions; actual speeds will vary).

 An 8 MB memory is standard as well as a 20-page automatic document feeder. The paper input tray has an input capacity of up to 100 sheets, and supports a variety of paper types and sizes, including paper (plain, inkjet, photo), envelopes, transparencies, labels, cards, iron-on transfers, letter, legal, executive, and more.

 The color scanner has a 36-bit color depth and a hardware resolution of up to 600 x 1,200 dpi, resulting in accurate, true-to-life scans perfect for a wide variety of applications. The included software bundle helps you to get the best prints and scans possible, and includes HP Director, HP Photo Gallery, HP Image Editor, and Readiris OCR.

 HP Director
Access features and common tasks through the easy-to-navigate HP Director software. Depending on the capabilities of your HP all-in-one, the HP Director lets you initiate device functions such as scanning, copying, faxing, or unloading images from a digital camera or memory card. You can also use the HP Director to open the HP Gallery to view, modify, and manage the images on your computer.

     Your features may vary. The HP Director is customized based upon the HP device that is selected. If your device is not equipped with a particular feature, then the icon for that feature will not display in the HP Director on your computer.

The copier has print speeds of up to 17 ppm for black and up to 12 ppm for color, with resolutions as high as 2,400 x 1,200 dpi. You can make up to 100 copies at a time, saving you time and hassle, while a zoom function allows you to reduce or enlarge copies from 25% to 200%. The fax machine is capable of full-color faxing and has a fast 3-second per page transmission time. A transmission memory of up to 100 pages lets submit large jobs, while a fax broadcast feature lets you send a single fax to 50 separate locations. The fax also features a junk fax barrier, remote retrieval, and auto-redial.

 The 4215 conveniently connects via USB and has a small 16.4-by-8-inch footprint. It is compatible with PC and Mac operating platforms and also comes backed by a one-year limited warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This powerful HP all-in-one packs four functions into one ultracompact machine. Whether you need to scan and print professional-looking photos, fax documents in a hurry, or make multiple copies—or all of the above—the OfficeJet 4215 will impress you with its efficiency and productivity.

 Features: 

 * Do everything you need with one, space-saving machine–easily print, fax, scan, and copy in color. 
 * Print professional-quality photos with the up to 4,800 optimized dpi (HP Premium photo paper, 1,200 x 1,200 dpi input) or six-ink color (with separate purchase of HP 58 photo inkjet cartridge), get laser-quality black text. 
 * Make copies right at your desk, at up to 17 copies per minute in black, 12 in color. 
 * Enjoy high-quality scanning at 600 x 1,200 dpi optical resolution, 36-bit color. 
 * Fax fast in color or black without a PC using the 33.6 Kbps modem, 80 speed dials, and automatic redial. 
 * Save time: fax, scan, and copy up to 20 pages at once with the automatic document feeder. 
 * Add visuals to your documents with the HP Image Zone Photo & Imaging software. 
 * Easily enlarge photos without a PC using the fit-to-page button; print both bordered and borderless (4-by-6-inch, using 4-by-6.5-inch HP Premium Plus photo paper) photos. 
 * Easily send photos to friends via e-mail without burdening them with large file attachments. 
 * Don't be caught without ink; the on-screen low ink warning keeps you informed of cartridge status. 
 * Enjoy the security of a one-year limited hardware warranty, one-year technical phone support.
